Articles.Content:
Hey, Ive been playing around for a few days now trying to launch and dock with my space station using mainly the iva and map view. I was having a lot of fun when I came across a small annoyance that never bothered me before.

When docking and undocking using the monitors from iva you have the slight pause as the vessel becomes one but it kicks you to the outside cam during this, I was just wanting to know if there are any addons out there or anyway of changing this to keep you in iva view after you have docked/undocked.

As I said it is only a small annoyance but wanted to put it out there just in case, Cheers.

If there's a more appropriate thread for this I apologize, I was hoping one of you talented guys might want to have a look in to it though
I'm not sure if Raster Prop Monitor has this function, but ALCOR might. It might also have externam cameras as parts. Not sure, though.

I'm not sure if Raster Prop Monitor has this function, but ALCOR might. It might also have externam cameras as parts. Not sure, though.

Hey, thanks for the reply, Lajoswinkler.

I am using both of these addons at the moment, they work great for the IVA only flights. The issue was with using raster prop, when un-docking/docking in iva it automatically changes the camera to external, resulting in you having to change the camera back. Its a very minor thing that no doubt would need a lot of work to get around lol.

I just think it would be awesome going the whole way from launch, rendezvousing with your target and re-entering Kerbins atmosphere without ever leaving the cockpit!

Yeah, that's a minor thing, really. You can't expect perfection with a work in progress.
